.
Medical Opinions and the Initial PTSD DBQ
The
Initial Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Disability Benefits Questionnaire
elicits from the examiner information relevant to the Veteran’s contended stressor(s), including an assessment of potential relationship to, and adequacy to support, the underlying diagnosis of PTSD.  Because this questioning sequence is inherent within the general PTSD examination protocol, do not routinely request a separate medical opinion DBQ unless a medical opinion that is not otherwise satisfied by completion of the
Initial Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Disability Benefits Questionnaire
is needed.
References
:  For more information on
examinations in claims for SC for PTSD, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 1.C
, and
the
Initial Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Disability Benefits Questionnaire
, see the
DBQ Switchboard
.
